Recipe.title: Chile Colorado
Recipe.Source: Based on a Recipe found online.
Recipe.Description: Di loves Chile Colorado, so we tried several Recipes. Then we found a good starting recipe online and used that as a starting point. We made some modifications and changed to using the InstaPot. Now we love it.

section.instruction: Remove stems and seed from the Dried Chiles.
Cut Onion into 4-6 chunks, and break chunks apart.
In small pot, put Chiles, Onions and Water and place on stove with burner set to high until it comes to a boil.
Turn burner off and let pot sit for 20 minutes.
Cut Stew Meat into chunks that are about 1&inch; square.
Place Oil in InstaPot and set it to Saut&accentE;.
When hot, add Stew Meat and cook until it starts to look golden on the outside, then turn InstaPot off.

Remove all of the Chiles and Onions from the pot of water and place in a blender, along with 1 cup of the now Red Water from the pot. Add Flour, Salt, Pepper, Oregano, Cumin and Garlic and blend until evenly smooth.
Pour the sauce from the blender into the InstaPot and stir.
Place the Beef Broth in the blender, and run it for a few seconds, then pour that into the InstaPot.
Set the InstaPot to Pressure Cook for 15 minutes.
After Pressure Cooking is complete, let it sit for 15 minutes, then release any pressure.

Notes.note: This must (sarcasm) be served with Mexican Fried Rice. If you start the recipe right when the Pressure Cooking is set, then both recipes should complete at about the same time.

Modifications.modification: You can create the 1½-Strength Beef Broth by using 3 Cups of Water + 4½ Bouillon Cubes (or the equivalent).
To make it more spicy, add 1-3 Arbol Chiles (Dried) with the other Chiles (Dried).
